_header: Hail star of the sea so bright / Thou grant us to been our guide
Subjects: Virgin Mary, hymns to; hymns, to Virgin Mary
_description:
Ave maris stella (cf. Daniel (1841)
XDaniel, Hermann Adalbert. Thesaurus Hymnologicus sive canticorum sequentiarum circa annum MD usitatarum collectio amplissima. 5 vols. in 4. Halis, 1841-56, 1.204) — fourteen 12-line stanzas, with Latin verse couplet before each pair of stanzas

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Heil sterre of þe see so brihtÞow graunt vs to ben vr
                    gyde…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…ffader and Sone and holy gostBeo wiþ us nou and euere.
                    Amen
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

Furnivall,  Frederick James,

             The Minor Poems of the Vernon Manuscript, Part 2.
EETS

Patterson,  Frank A. 
             The Middle English Penitential Lyric.
Columbia University Studies in English.
         New York: Columbia Press, 1911: 112-17.

                    Amen
BLAdd22283.Attributed Title:
Ave maris stella dei mater alma / Atque semper virgo felix celi
                        porta (f. 133vb)
